title: Fantasy Football Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: After hold-in, Bills' Cook gets 4-year, $48M deal
content: Running back James Cook and the Bills have reached agreement on a four-year, $48 million contract extension that includes $30 million guaranteed, his agents told ESPN.

title: Halos' Neto turns his 1st triple play off Ohtani liner
content: Zach Neto -- who had never been part of a triple play in the minors, college or even Little League -- helped the Angels turn one Tuesday night off a line drive by Dodgers slugger Shohei Ohtani, before winning in extra innings.

title: Alonso passes Strawberry as Mets' new HR king
content: Pete Alonso hit his 253rd career homer Tuesday night, breaking the franchise record held by Darryl Strawberry for 37 years.

title: Rodgers on new helmet: Looks like a 'spaceship'
content: Aaron Rodgers says he doesn't like the helmet he has been wearing this year, saying it "looks like a damn spaceship."

title: Knee injury ends Vikes WR Moore's season again
content: Vikings receiver/punt returner Rondale Moore suffered a season-ending left knee injury in Saturday's preseason game against the Texans, the team confirmed Tuesday.

title: Packers QB Love has procedure on left thumb
content: Jordan Love had a procedure to repair a ligament injury to his left thumb, but the Packers expect the star QB to be ready for their season opener.

title: Richardson apologizes to boyfriend after arrest
content: Sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson addressed her recent domestic violence arrest in a video on social media and issued an apology to her boyfriend, Christian Coleman.

title: What is every NFL team's ceiling and floor this season? We crunched the numbers
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: Barnwell: How Jerry Jones' bungled contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100 million
content: What are the Cowboys doing?!? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Can UNC quarterback Max Johnson keep his dream alive?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: Time to panic in New York? What to make of slumping Yankees and Mets
content: Not long ago, both N.Y. teams seemed to be cruising toward October -- then things took a turn for the worse.

title: Rankings: Eric Moody's QB tiers
content: Creating your own rankings tiers is an essential part of the draft prep process. Eric Moody provides his quarterbacks tiers to give you a head start.

title: Taylor Swift to join Travis Kelce on 'New Heights,' reveals new album
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: LaLiga 2025-26 burning questions: Barça, Real Madrid, title race, Mbappé vs. Yamal
content: The new LaLiga season is upon us! Will Barcelona and Real Madrid dominate? Will Atlético spoil the party? Will Mbappé or Yamal shine brightest?

title: How Flick won his battle with Ter Stegen in Barça coach's riskiest move yet
content: Barcelona pushed things to the limit with its injured captain. Time will tell if the gambit was a success.

title: 'It's made us pretty thin': Packers' injury woes are mounting with Love, others hurt
content: There is time to get healthy before Week 1, but myriad health issues in Green Bay are making things tough.

title: How every five-star recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: The midfield is getting interesting as Aces turn things around
content: With Las Vegas surging and Seattle struggling, the middle of the Power Rankings (and standings) get a shake-up.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton
content: Real Madrid are among the clubs looking at Crystal Palace and England midfielder Adam Wharton. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Venmo requests and death threats: Heckling in the digital sports betting age
content: Being an athlete in the public eye can have its perks, but also many challenges. The most recent one? Bettors requesting money if they aren't getting the wins.

title: UConn offers stadium suite as part of fantasy football draft hosting package
content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

title: Six-year-old child from Ghana undergoes open heart surgery at Jayadeva institute in Bengaluru
content: With lack of adequate facilities in Ghana for such complex heart surgery, the parents were advised to take the child to Jayadeva institute

title: Preparation for Independence Day 2025 celebrations in Bengaluru
content: Rains disrupted preparations for Independence Day 2025 celebrations in Bengaluru on August 13, 2025.

title: Resignation only option before Justice Varma to avoid removal by Parliament, rules say
content: Should he decide to resign, he will get a pension and other benefits entitled to a retired high court judge, but if he is removed by Parliament, he will be deprived of pension and other benefits, they noted.

title: Transport department employees’ union warns of Statewide stir from August 27 over pending dues, land row
content: Union leaders cite unpaid benefits, stalled promotions, and transfer of ₹400-cr Vijayawada land to LuLu Group; gives government deadline till Vinayaka Chaviti

title: CCB files charge sheet in DGP Omprakash murder case, daughter’s name excluded
content: The victim’s wife, Pallavi, has been accused of stabbing him to death over a property dispute at their house on April 20, 2025.

title: Two feared drowned in Krishna river in Guntur district; search operation on
content: District administration launches rescue efforts as heavy rains inundate parts of Guntur; schools in vulnerable areas told to close temporarily

title: Enforcement Directorate conducts fresh raids in Bihar illegal liquor smuggling case
content: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches in multiple states under PMLA linked to illegal liquor smuggling case, assets attached

title: Mumbai 26/11 attack: Delhi court allows Tahawwur Rana three phone calls with relatives
content: According to the sources, the judge said the phone calls by Rana will be recorded and the conversations will have to be in English or Hindi in the presence of prison authorities

title: Woman sexually harassed, robbed by armed man at Bengaluru PG accommodation
content: When the victim raised an alarm, the accused grabbed two mobile phones, worth ₹75,000, lying on the bed and escaped.

title: Watch: What happens to ‘missing names’ on Bihar SIR list?
content: By August 1, the draft electoral roll was published. But the numbers raised questions. Compared to the previous rolls, the draft list was missing over 65 lakh voters

title: Nine suspected Rohingyas detained in Assam's Cachar
content: Residents of Bishwanbharpur village in Katigorah area near the border spotted a group of unfamiliar people and after questioning them, handed them over to the police

title: T.N. research scholar refuses to receive degree from Governor Ravi at convocation
content: “Since the Governor has done nothing for Tamils and Tamil Nadu, and is working against the State, I chose to receive the degree from Dr. Chandrasekar,” said Jean Joseph who is also the wife of DMK’s Nagercoil town deputy secretary.

title: Unidentified man charred to death while sleeping in parked bus in Bengaluru
content: Police suspect that the death was due to an accidental fire sparked by the burning beedis, found around the body

title: Bill to form trust for Mathura's Banke Bihari temple introduced in Uttar Pradesh Assembly
content: The House was informed that devotees and visitors face great inconvenience due to the very narrow path leading up to the temple

title: Vision 2047 document: Shivpal, Akhilesh Yadav accuse Uttar Pradesh Government of ignoring present-day issues
content: Shivpal Yadav called the Vision 2047 a "fictional" exercise and accused the government of being a "trader of tomorrow's dreams" without solutions for current problems

title: V.S. Sunil Kumar tells Kerala Chief Electoral Officer that vote fraud declaration demand ‘unsustainable in law’
content: Sunil Kumar reiterates charge that several BJP workers who were not ordinarily residents in Thrissur were included in electoral rolls for parliamentary constituency ahead of 2024 elections

title: Congress, VCK, and Left parties to boycott Tamil Nadu Governor’s tea party on Independence Day
content: Mr. Selvaperunthagai said that the boycott was to condemn the “anti-Tamil Nadu activities” of the Governor and against the Election Commission of India’s Special Intensive Revision carried out in Bihar

title: Congress leader Anil Akkara alleges Suresh Gopi’s brother, sister-in-law hold dual voter ID cards
content: Anil Akkara accuses BJP of orchestrating a wider conspiracy, claiming that ‘it is not just Suresh Gopi’s relatives, but thousands of voters with duplicate IDs have been inserted into Thrissur’s rolls under BJP’s direction’

title: Anwhar Raajhaa, Maitreyan will not stay in any political party permanently, says Palaniswami
content: Mr. Palaniswami’s reaction comes in the wake of Mr. Maitreyan, former AIADMK Rajya Sabha MP, joining the DMK on Wednesday in the presence of Chief Minister M.K. Stalin at Anna Arivalayam, Chennai.

title: Odisha gang rape case: all five accused arrested
content: While the prime accused has already been sent to jail after a local court rejected the bail application, the four others will be produced in court later in the day, police said

title: Poverty prevents people from filing appeals, says Madras High Court; orders release of life convict citing parity
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan say: “all that we are doing is performing our constitutional duty”

title: Low pressure over Bay of Bengal to trigger heavy rainfall in A.P.
content: The A.P. State Disaster Management Authority (APSDMA) has sounded a note of caution to the public as the districts of NTR, Krishna, West Godavari, Eluru, Guntur, Palnadu, Bapatla and Prakasam are likely to receive heavy rain on these two days.

title: Police bust criminal gang targeting LGBTQ+ people on dating app in Kerala
content: The accused landed in police custody recently when one of the victims lodged a complaint with local police alleging that they had extorted his gold chain and ring, worth two and a half sovereigns, and later abandoned him in a deserted place

title: BJP alleges irregularities in polls in Kalathur, Rae Bareilly, Diamond Harbour, and Wayanad
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK supremo M.K. Stalin, and Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav should resign for ‘rigging’ elections, BJP leader and former Union Minister Anurag Thakur said

title: Jagan questions Rahul’s silence over issues concerning A.P., alleges Congress-TDP nexus
content: Speaking at a media interaction in Tadepalli, Mr. Jagan alleged that Mr. Gandhi is in “direct contact” with Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu.

title: No decision yet on MVA fighting Maharashtra local body polls together: Chennithala
content: Asked whether the MVA partners will contest these polls together, Mr. Chennithala said the Congress will deliberate on the issue and that the alliance “may or may not take place”

title: Chennai Corporation conservancy workers can protest only in authorised places: Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder say the protesters cannot block pavements and pathways outside Ripon Building

title: Telangana IT Minister lashes out at Centre for not approving Semicon projects for State despite full preparedness
content: AP given one despite not ready with land and preliminary work, Sridhar Babu alleged, saying Telangana had initiated various measures including 10 acre allocation to the same firm

title: Journalist assaulted for protesting alcohol consumption inside anganwadi centre in Indore
content: The journalist stopped the individuals from drinking liquor inside the facility but they started abusing him and demanded money from him for alcohol, police said

title: One held for ‘assaulting’ police constable during RG Kar crime anniversary protest
content: Chaos and violent agitation dominated the streets of Kolkata and adjacent Howrah on August 9, a day that marked the completion of one year of the rape and murder of the doctor at the state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital.

title: BJP leader K. Surendran slams allegations of bogus votes in Thrissur, defends Suresh Gopi
content: Former BJP Kerala president says opposing parties failed to detect fraud earlier; vows strong political resistance

title: Court dismisses producer Sandra Thomas’ plea challenging rejection of nomination for KFPA president post
content: Her interim applications for holding election under court’s monitoring and to restrain returning officer from acting further on any aspects related to conduct of election are also dismissed

title: Congress highlights 'vote chori' with video; Mallikarjun Kharge asks people to raise voice
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also shared the video on X, and said, "the theft of your vote is theft of your rights, theft of your identity"

title: Get your copy of The Hindu’s rare 1947 Independence Day edition
content: A rare 1947 Independence Day edition of The Hindu returns to print, filled with bold headlines, jubilant ads, and the small, stirring details of a nation’s first day of freedom.

title: 'Ask Pakistan': US Refuses To Answer If Pak Lost F-16s During Op Sindoor
content: The US government has refused to answer specific queries on the loss of Pakistan Air Force-operated F-16 fighter jets during Op Sindoor, the intense 88-hour battle fought by India and Pakistan between May 7 and May 10.

title: Why Perplexity, Valued At $18 Billion, Made $34.5 Billion Offer For Chrome
content: Perplexity AI has made an unsolicited offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser for $34.5 billion, a price tag nearly double its own valuation.

title: Mumbai's Pigeon Feeding Ban: How A Public Health Move Clashed With Faith
content: Science and faith have clashed in Mumbai, and pigeons are enjoying a feast. The shutdown of Mumbai's kabootarkhanas to prevent the public health hazard caused by pigeon droppings has triggered widespread protests

title: Stray Dogs Attack Nagpur Girl While She Was Playing, Bite Her Hands, Legs
content: A four-year-old girl was left with bloody injuries in her legs and arms after a pack of stray dogs attacked her in Maharashtra's Nagpur.

title: Video: PhD Scholar Snubs Tamil Nadu Governor At Convocation, Walks Past Him
content: A PhD scholar refused to receive her degree from Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi at the 32nd convocation of the Manonmaniam Sundaranar University, alleging that he has "acted against the interests of Tamil Nadu".

title: Video: Rain Halts Kedarnath Yatra, Pilgrims Break Barricades, Lathicharged
content: Stopped from proceeding to the Kedarnath temple because of heavy rainfall on the route, a group of pilgrims broke through barricades in Uttarakhand's Sonprayag, forcing the police to carry out a mild lathi charge.

title: When Subhash Chandra Bose Declared Independence In Andaman In 1943
content: In 1943, Subhash Chandra Bose hoisted the Tricolour in Port Blair, renamed the Andamans as Shaheed Island and the Nicobars as Swaraj Island.

title: Row Over Bihar Mayor's "Twin Voter ID Cards", Poll Body Sends Notice
content: The Mayor of Muzaffarpur have been asked to explain two voter ID cards that she allegedly has, sources have said.

title: Adani Digital Labs Unveils Key Initiatives To Elevate Airport, Travel Experience
content: Adani Digital Labs (ADL), the technology arm of Adani Airport Holdings Limited (AAHL), has announced a series of transformative initiatives aimed at redefining the travel and airport experience for passengers across Adani-managed airports in India.

title: 'Do or Die': Mahatma Gandhi's Call That Sparked India's Final Push For Freedom
content: When the British refused to grant India freedom despite the sacrifices the country made during World War II, Mahatma Gandhi's clarion call of "Do or Die" became the anthem of a nation ready to risk everything.

title: Why Pakistan Celebrates Independence Day On August 14, And India On August 15
content: India is not the only country that celebrates its independence from British rule in August. While India commemorates independence on August 15, Pakistan, born out of the 1947 Partition, celebrates its Independence Day on August 14.

title: "BrahMos Hai Hamare Paas": Asaduddin Owaisi Replies To Pak PM's Threat
content: Hitting back at Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's threat to India over the Indus Waters Treaty, Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the Pakistani leader "should not talk nonsense" and added a BrahMos warning.

title: DMK Adopts Resolution Condemning 'Mass Voter Deletions' By Poll Body In Bihar
content: Tamil Nadu's DMK has launched a sharp attack on ECI, accusing it of acting in concert with BJP to undermine free and fair polls through what it called "mass voter deletions" under Special Intensive Revision process in Bihar

title: Decoded: Mamata-Abhishek Banerjee's Joint Strategy For Bengal Polls 2026
content: The West Bengal Assembly election is expected around April-May next year, after Bihar votes for a new government this year-end.

title: On Camera, UP Man Slaps Sister, Beats Boyfriend With Iron Rod At Pizza Joint
content: The brother, reportedly enraged upon seeing his sister with her boyfriend, began attacking the young man.

title: Auction Of World's Largest Mars Meteorite Sparks Ownership Debate
content: The recent auction of a Martian meteorite -- for a record-grabbing $5.3 million at Sotheby's New York -- has sparked questions over its provenance and renewed debate over who gets to claim rocks fallen from the heavens.

title: Trump's Soft Landing Strategy In Action, Reassigns Officials To United Nations
content: NSA Mike Waltz was nominated as UN ambassador after he mistakenly added a journalist to a Signal chat discussing military plans. Donald Trump last weekend named State Department spokesperson Tammy Bruce as deputy representative to the UN

title: Israel PM Netanyahu Floats "Allowing" Palestinians Out Of Gaza Amid Truce Push
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday revived calls to "allow" Palestinians to leave the Gaza Strip, as the military prepares a broader offensive in the territory.

title: Opinion: Opinion | China Is Playing the Long Game on Trade. It's Working
content: President Donald Trump's trade war was meant to rebalance global power in America's favor. Instead, China is playing the long game, enduring short-term economic pain to shape any eventual deal to its advantage.

title: BJP marches to Thrissur City Police Commissioner’s office over attack on party workers, Suresh Gopi’s office
content: March was blocked with police barricades near Commissioner’s office. Waving party flags, BJP workers climb onto barricades refusing to disperse despite water cannon use thrice

title: DMK district secretaries’ meeting passes resolution condemning SIR, ‘vote theft’
content: Despite protests by Opposition parties and a warning from the Supreme Court, the deletion of 65 lakh voters on frivolous grounds is an anti-democratic act, the resolution alleged

title: Kerala to award grace marks to students for participating in reading activities from next academic year
content: In a Facebook post, General Education Minister Sivankutty says one period a week will be set aside for students of Classes I to IV to participate in reading and related activities. Students from Classes V to XII will engage in newspaper reading and assigned activities

title: AMMA election: Stars face off as high-stakes battle looms in Malayalam actors’ body
content: Shwetha Menon takes on senior actor Devan in the race for the top post, while Kukku Parameswaran faces Raveendran for post of general secretary. Election to be held on August 15

title: Class 11 student faints in classroom, dies in Villupuram
content: A student of Saraswathi Matric Higher Secondary School, Mohan Raj had reached the school premises at around 7.00 a.m. to attend special classes. He collapsed in his classroom a few seconds after sitting at his desk.

title: Punjab AAP MLA Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina injured in road accident in Haryana
content: The accident occurred near the Kharak Pandwa toll in Kalayat in Kaithal when Ms. Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina was returning from Delhi.

title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall forecast in Hyderabad on August 13
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD), which had earlier issued an orange alert for Hyderabad and its surrounding areas, upgraded it to a red alert on August 13 afternoon

title: Indian Olympic Association formally approves India's 2030 Commonwealth Games bid
content: A team of officials from Commonwealth Sport, led by its Director of Games Darren Hall, recently visited Ahmedabad to inspect the venues and meet Gujarat government officials

title: Karnataka rain: Office-goers in Bengaluru stuck in their vehicles as junctions inundated by overnight rain
content: Traffic personnel deployed on the ground were seen clearing waterlogged stretches at several locations

title: Uttar Pradesh court orders FIR against Union MoS for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh, four others in land dispute case
content: According to officials, the order was issued on Monday (August 11, 2025) by Special Judge of the MP-MLA Court (Civil Judge, Senior Division) Apeksha Singh, who instructed Mankapur police station to lodge an FIR against Kirti Vardhan Singh, Rajesh Singh, Pinku Singh, Sahdev Yadav and Kanti Singh

title: Former AIADMK MP Maitreyan joins DMK
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami, meanwhile, has announced Mr. Maitreyan’s expulsion from the party

title: Bus-truck collision in U.P.’s Jaunpur leaves five dead, 15 injured
content: According to police, the accident was caused due to the negligence of the bus driver, who swerved to the right and hit the truck.

title: CJI agrees to consider listing stray dog issue after petitioner unearths 2024 SC order to treat animals with compassion
content: In an urgent mentioning, a lawyer informed the Chief Justice about a May 9, 2024 order to treat stray canines with compassion.

title: Illegal betting app case: Suresh Raina appears before Enforcement Directorate on August 13
content: Once he deposes, the Enforcement Directorate is expected to record his statements under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act

title: My role in Telugu film Paradha, an emotionally challenging one: Anupama Parameswaran
content: In Paradha, Anupama plays Subbu, a young woman raised to believe that marriage and motherhood are a woman’s ultimate destiny.

title: Bengaluru Metro: Coaches for fourth train set for Yellow Line begin arriving at Hebbagodi depot
content: According to BMRCL officials, one coach has reached the Hebbagodi depot while the remaining five coaches of the set are in transit to Bengaluru

title: Supreme Court cancels wrestler Sushil Kumar’s bail in Chhatrasal Stadium murder case
content: A Bench of justices Sanjay Karol and Prashant Kumar Mishra set aside the March 4 order of the Delhi High Court granting bail to the wrestler and asks the wrestler to surrender within a week

title: Stop using 'Harijan' word in official communications: Odisha Government
content: "They have been instructed to ensure that the word 'Harijan' does not appear in any official communications, records, transactions, caste certificates, publications, departmental names, or any other form of use," an official said

title: ED raids on Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail in Karnataka, others in illegal iron ore export case
content: At least 15 premises linked to Karnataka Congress MLA Satish Krishna Sail and some others in Karnataka, Goa and Mumbai are being searched under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), sources said

title: Madras High Court refuses to entertain PIL seeking to restrain retired judges from issuing public letters, appeals, or statements
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava, presiding over the first Division Bench along with Justice Sunder Mohan, says it is a “publicity interest litigation”

title: Road accident in Dausa, Rajasthan: 7 children among 11 killed as pickup van rams into truck
content: The passengers of the pickup vehicle were returning to their village in Uttar Pradesh’s Etah after visiting Khatu Shyam and Salasar Balaji temple when the accident occurred on Manoharpur highway

title: Tejashwi claims Muzaffarpur Mayor has two EPIC numbers, days after allegation against Bihar Deputy CM
content: Following the allegation by the RJD leader, the EC issued a notice to Muzaffarpur Mayor Nirmala Devi and sought her reply by August 16

title: Army foils infiltration bid in J&K's Uri, soldier killed
content: District Magistrate of Samba orders night curfew in areas up to 2 km from the International Border. The restriction will be in place daily from 10 pm to 5 am for the next two months unless withdrawn earlier.

title: India ‘bit recalcitrant’ on trade negotiations: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent
content: “... the big trade deals that aren’t done or aren’t agreed - Switzerland is still around, India has been a bit recalcitrant,” Mr. Bessent said in an interview

title: BJP Kerala president Rajeev Chandrasekhar accuses CPI(M), Congress of collusion in Thrissur voter fraud controversy
content: Rajeev Chandrasekhar says INDIA bloc allies are resorting to muckraking to rob the sheen of Union Minister Suresh Gopi’s upset victory in Thrissur

title: Delhi govt. puts brakes on fuel ban for overage vehicles amid outcry
content: The Delhi government would make “all efforts” to address problems related to the ELV ban, says CM  Rekha Gupta

title: Heavy rain overnight brings over 20 cm of rainfall to three places in Telangana
content: The India Meteorological Department issues alerts as Telangana faces heavy rainfall; the Health Minister directs hospitals to prepare for emergencies

title: Suresh Gopi arrives in Thrissur amid voter list controversy, declines media questions
content: BJP workers welcome Suresh Gopi at Thrissur railway station. Union Minister to call on BJP workers injured in clash with CPI(M) at hospital

title: PM Modi likely to visit U.S. for UNGA session next month
content: According to the provisional list of speakers for the high-level debate of the 80th session of the General Assembly, India’s “Head of Government (HG)” will address the session on the morning of September 26

title: Hyphenated nationality and the paradox of the nation state
content: The very mechanism that creates national belonging — the conflation of ethnic, territorial, and political identity — simultaneously produces categories of exclusion and suspicion

title: India monsoon rains LIVE: IMD issues red alert to several places in Telangana; heavy rain alert for several Arunachal districts
content: “Red warnings have been issued to central districts of Telangana, including Sangareddy, Medak, Vikarabad, Khammam and Mulugu for today,” a Met Centre official said. The IMD has forecast heavy rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning in several parts of Arunachal Pradesh over the next 24 hours.

title: SIR of Bihar’s electoral rolls and its political ripple effects across India: Data
content: A citizen from Bihar voting in their State and voting in Maharashtra or Kerala will have different implications

title: Three government officials, private surveyor arrested by Telangana ACB in separate bribery cases
content: All three cases are under investigation, and the identities of the complainants have been withheld for security reasons

title: Institutional bodies must come together to prevent Bengaluru from becoming a gas chamber like Delhi: Khandre
content: For a person to live comfortably, there should be seven trees per person, but in Bengaluru, there isn’t even one tree for every seven people: Minister

title: Maharashtra Cabinet approves 15,000 Police posts
content: The Fadnavis-led Cabinet took major decisions such as subsidising air fares, raising margins for ration shop dealers and easing loan norms

title: Aravalli forest reforestation under scrutiny by ABCM trustees, alleging conflict of interest and environmental violations
content: The group members alleged that the action was in violation of several laws protecting forests and environment and an instance of “wrong prioritisation”

title: Release prisoners who have completed sentence: Supreme Court
content: The top court passed the direction while ordering the release of Sukhdev Yadav, alias Pehalwan, in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder case

title: Fatehpur mausoleum vandalism sparks ruckus in U.P. Assembly
content: Opposition alleges BJP leaders incited the crowd, accuses it of shielding culprits and demand accountability; govt. says FIR lodged in the incident, promises legal action

title: “Separate group misusing SAD’s name, will file criminal complaint,” says Akali Dal
content: He also termed the move as illegal, unconstitutional and immoral and said the SAD was consulting legal experts in order to file a formal criminal complaint in this regard

title: Rajiv Pratap Rudy prevails in BJP Vs BJP Constitution Club fight
content: BJP’s Saran MP Rudy has been at the helm of the Constitution Club for nearly a quarter of a century and was largely credited with reviving it from the largely dilapidated state it had fallen into in the years past

title: Journalists’ articles, videos prima facie not sedition: SC
content: The Supreme Court has shielded 'The Wire' editor Siddharth Varadarajan from arrest under Section 152 of the BNS, cautioning against implicating journalists for news articles. Justices emphasized that a news report doesn't inherently threaten national unity, even while hearing a case against the validity of Section 152.

title: ‘Evidence of crime’: Congress challenges BJP over Sonia Gandhi voter ID claim
content: The Congress party is demanding that the BJP provide evidence to support claims that Sonia Gandhi possessed a voter ID before becoming an Indian citizen. Pawan Khera also requested result data from the Varanasi constituency, questioning PM Modi's victory margin.

title: ‘Reprehensible act’: Indian temple in US vandalised; consulate seeks probe
content: The BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in Greenwood, Indiana, was vandalized, drawing strong condemnation from the Indian Consulate in Chicago, who have urged law enforcement to take swift action. This incident follows a similar act of vandalism at a BAPS temple in Chino Hills, California, less than six months ago.

title: SC stray dog order row: How the world tackles strays — from mass sterilisation drives to euthanasia
content: Amid rising stray dog bites, the Supreme Court has ordered the removal of all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters, banning their return to the streets. The order warns of strict action against obstruction. Globally, effective strategies include universal microchipping, large-scale CNVR/TNVR programs, rabies control, adoption pipelines, and abandonment enforcement.

title: Tragic shocker! Para-athlete dies after rabid dog attack
content: In a tragic incident, para-athlete Jogendra Chhatria and Hrusikesh Rana succumbed to rabies 19 days after being bitten by a stray dog in Balangir district. Despite receiving anti-rabies vaccinations, their condition worsened, leading to their deaths. The incident has sparked outrage in the village, prompting calls for action against rabid dogs.

title: Perplexity, itself valued at $18 billion, offers $34.5 billion for Google Chrome
content: Perplexity, an AI search startup, has made a bold $34.5 billion all-cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, aiming to challenge Google's search dominance. This move comes as Google faces antitrust pressure to divest Chrome. Perplexity pledges significant investment in Chrome's development and open-source nature, while maintaining user choice and continuity.

title: WATCH: 'Only thing I can do with broken foot … ' — Rishabh Pant turns chef
content: Rishabh Pant, currently sidelined with a fractured right foot sustained during the England Test series, is keeping his spirits high by indulging in pizza baking. He shared a light-hearted video on social media, showcasing his culinary skills while humorously acknowledging his lack of cooking at home. Pant's playful attitude and pizza-making adventures are keeping him busy during his recovery.

title: Jaishankar to visit Russia, hold talks with Lavrov amid tension with US
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will meet Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on August 21. This meeting follows increased tariffs imposed by the US on Indian imports. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval recently met Russian President Vladimir Putin. Discussions during that meeting were not disclosed. Putin is expected to visit India before the end of 2025.

title: Audi employees in Germany: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, Jörg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: Yuzvendra Chahal's estranged wife Dhanashree Verma dances with Big Boss winner - WATCH
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce from Dhanashree Verma was finalized on March 20, 2025, in Mumbai. The event grabbed attention when Chahal arrived at the family court wearing a T-shirt that read, “Be Your Own Sugar Daddy.

title: When India pulled out of Asia Cup — And the big story behind it
content: The 2025 Asia Cup will be held in the UAE from September 9-28, featuring eight teams in the T20I format. India's participation was initially uncertain due to strained relations with Pakistan, but the BCCI has confirmed their presence. India will play Pakistan in a high-profile match on September 14, with potential for multiple encounters throughout the tournament.

title: ‘Coolie’ first review: Udhayanidhi Stalin hails Rajinikanth’s 50 years in cinema
content: Udhayanidhi Stalin congratulated Rajinikanth on his 50th year in film and praised 'Coolie' after a preview. He lauded the film as a power-packed entertainer, anticipating global success. Stalin extended wishes to the cast and crew, including Nagarjuna, Sathyaraj, Aamir Khan, and Shruti Haasan, heightening anticipation for the film's release in over 100 countries.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: There is no world where I would allow employees to say...
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: Travis Kelce’s dad praises Taylor Swift’s The Life of a Showgirl: ‘It’s going to be beautiful’
content: Taylor Swift revealed her new album, *The Life of a Showgirl*, on the *New Heights* podcast, hosted by Travis and Jason Kelce, surprising even Ed Kelce. Swift has been working on the album in LA after securing the rights to her first six albums.

title: 'In any serious nation ...': Op Sindoor heroes to feature on TV show; opposition objects
content: Opposition parties in India have criticized the appearance of three military officers from Operation Sindoor on a television program. The officers were featured on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati', an entertainment show. Concerns were raised about the appropriateness of discussing a military operation on a private entertainment platform.

title: Delhi stray dog crackdown: 700 caught near Red Fort
content: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is initiating a phased approach to manage the city's stray dog population, following a Supreme Court order. Aggressive and diseased dogs are being removed from specific areas, with plans to intensify efforts post-Independence Day.

title: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'
content: India spin legend Harbhajan Singh has strongly advocated for India to boycott Pakistan matches in the upcoming Asia Cup, echoing the sentiment of 'nation first.' He highlights the sacrifices of soldiers on the border and questions the importance given to Pakistan by the media. Harbhajan was part of the India Champions team that refused to play Pakistan in the WCL.

title: Wilson's wife Ciara first descendant of enslaved Africans to get Benin citizenship under new law
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Not just Rohit! Ex-India pacer says he's also been called George Clooney
content: RP Singh reminisced about the electrifying celebrations following India's 2007 T20 World Cup victory, highlighting the unforgettable Mumbai parade. He also shared an anecdote involving Rahul Dravid during a Ranji Trophy match, illustrating the pressures faced by even the greatest batsmen. Singh humorously recounted instances of being mistaken for Rohit Sharma and even George Clooney.

title: Another Indian attacked in Ireland: Man assaulted by teenagers; receives 8 stitches
content: An Indian national in Dublin was recently assaulted by a group of teenagers in Fairview Park, prompting him to return to India. The victim recounted being kicked and beaten, with bystanders failing to intervene until two teenagers aided him and alerted the police.

title: UP shocker: Aunt gouges out 12-year-old’s eye for ‘dropping’ infant
content: In Agra, a 12-year-old girl suffered permanent vision loss in one eye after her aunt allegedly attacked her with a steel hairband. The incident occurred when the girl accidentally dropped the aunt's infant daughter. Police have registered a case against the aunt, while the girl receives treatment at AIIMS Delhi, with her father alleging that police diluted the charges.

title: Assam: 14 police personnel injured after mob attack in Hojai; at least 7 arrested
content: ​​At least 14 police personnel were injured after a mob attacked a police team and damaged police vehicles in Assam’s Hojai district on Tuesday, August 12. The incident took place in the Digholbali area, news agency ANI reported.

title: Drunk man beaten to death after he claims he ‘killed’ child; kid’s killer held in 2019
content: In Chhattisgarh's Sakti district, a 45-year-old man, Surve Das Mahant, was beaten to death after drunkenly claiming responsibility for a 2019 murder for which a juvenile had already been convicted. Enraged villagers stripped and assaulted Mahant, who had a history of petty crime, after he argued with relatives and confessed to killing their child.

title: Bermuda Triangle ‘mystery’ solved? Scientist explains the real cause
content: The Bermuda Triangle's infamous reputation for unexplained disappearances is largely unfounded, according to scientist Karl Kruszelnicki and supported by NOAA and Lloyd's of London. The region's high traffic volume, combined with challenging environmental conditions like the Gulf Stream and frequent storms, accounts for the incidents. Human error and equipment failure also play significant roles, debunking myths of supernatural forces.

title: Exclusion of Aadhaar from Bihar SIR: SC observes 11 docs more 'voter friendly' than 7
content: The Supreme Court has observed that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) in Bihar, requiring 11 documents, is more voter-friendly than the previous summary revision's seven. Despite arguments against excluding Aadhaar, the court highlighted the inclusionary nature of the extensive document list. Petitioners, however, argued that the documents have limited coverage among the population, citing low passport ownership.

title: AIIMS exodus: 429 doctors quit 20 institutes in 2 years
content: A significant number of doctors, 429, have resigned from 20 AIIMS institutions between 2022 and 2024, with AIIMS Delhi experiencing the highest number of departures. This exodus coincides with a critical shortage of faculty, as nearly one-third of faculty positions remain vacant across all AIIMS.

title: Taylor Swift reveals why she went public with Travis Kelce after years of privacy
content: Taylor Swift openly embraced her relationship with Travis Kelce, contrasting sharply with her past privacy, particularly with Joe Alwyn. Swift explained to TIME that they proudly support each other, dismissing the need to hide their romance. Since 2023, they've been publicly affectionate, attending events and date nights, fueling engagement speculations.

title: Govt tightens OCI rules: Overseas citizenship holders risk losing status
content: The Indian government has announced that Overseas Citizen of India (OCI) cardholders could have their registration cancelled if they are convicted and sentenced to imprisonment for two years or more. The OCI card can also be revoked if they are charge-sheeted for an offense that carries a potential jail term of seven years or more, according to a recent notification.

title: ICC Rankings: Babar Azam slips below Rohit Sharma, three Indians in Top 5
content: Rohit Sharma has overtaken Babar Azam to claim the No. 2 spot in the ICC Men’s ODI Batting Rankings, fueled by Babar's recent struggles against the West Indies. In T20Is, Tim David and Dewald Brevis made significant jumps, while Matt Henry surged to third in Test Bowling Rankings after New Zealand's series win over Zimbabwe.

title: Indo-China trade! China loosens urea export curbs amid Trump tariff threat
content: China is easing urea export restrictions to India, potentially sending up to 300,000 tons, signaling improved relations amid trade tensions with the US. This shift follows increased tariffs by the US on Indian goods and comes after strained relations due to border conflicts in 2020.

title: Assam university’s Rs 30cr guest house turns luxury hotel, stirs row
content: Assam Agricultural University's international guesthouse, built for academic events, is now a luxury hotel. The facility, Rohika AAU-International Guest House, was leased to a private firm. Student and teacher bodies are against this decision. They argue the property should remain under public control. The veterinary college may soon become a full-fledged university.

title: Girl, 14, jumps off Madras HC building after it orders to send her to govt shelter
content: Upset by a Madras High Court order to be sent to a government home, a 14-year-old girl attempted to escape by jumping from the court's first floor. The court's decision stemmed from the girl's reluctance to live with either her divorced father or mother, and concerns about her safety with her mother in the Andamans.

title: Bihar polls: 'EC is helping BJP,' alleges RJD's Tejashwi Yadav
content: Tejashwi Yadav accused the Election Commission of India of colluding with the BJP to manipulate Bihar's voter list, alleging the issuance of multiple EPIC numbers to BJP leaders and workers. He claimed names of people from other states were being added to Bihar's voter list.

title: Noida hotel denies Kolkata techie, son stay; OYO apologises
content: A Kolkata techie and his son, a national-level skater, were allegedly denied accommodation at a Noida hotel. The hotel cited police instructions against accommodating guests from Bangladesh, Punjab, and Jammu & Kashmir, which the police denied issuing. OYO has apologized, removed the hotel from its platform, and initiated an inquiry into the incident.

title: ‘Will look into it’: CJI Gavai on SC stray dogs order
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has assured to review a plea challenging the Supreme Court's recent directive to relocate all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters. The matter was brought to the CJI's attention, highlighting a previous order by another bench against the killing and relocation of community dogs, emphasizing compassion for all living beings.

title: IPL: LSG set to part ways with Zaheer Khan; new mentor to hold more responsibilities
content: Lucknow Super Giants are set to part ways with mentor Zaheer Khan ahead of IPL 2026. The former India pacer also handled bowling duties during his tenure. Whoever will replace Zaheer will have expanded responsibilities across RPSG Group’s global cricket franchises.

title: BJP digs up 1980 poll roll with Sonia's name; claims she became Indian in 1983
content: BJP has retaliated against Congress's 'vote chori' allegation, asserting that Sonia Gandhi's name appeared on electoral rolls in 1980, before she became an Indian citizen. Amit Malviya highlighted this as a violation of electoral law. Anurag Thakur presented alleged discrepancies in Congress-held constituencies, accusing the party of historical electoral malpractices.

title: Infiltration bid foiled in Uri: 1 soldier killed in action; operation under way
content: An infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Jammu & Kashmir's Uri sector was foiled by the army, resulting in the death of a soldier during the exchange of fire. Security forces have been on high alert following intelligence inputs suggesting possible infiltration attempts from across the LoC and the international border.

title: First since 2021! India’s Nayara ships diesel to China amid EU's Russia oil curbs
content: An Indian diesel shipment is heading to China, marking the first delivery since 2021, amidst uncertainty surrounding exports from Russia-affiliated Nayara Energy due to EU sanctions. The vessel, carrying approximately 496,000 barrels of ultra-low sulfur diesel, departed from Nayara's Vadinar facility.

title: IOA formally approves India's bid to stage the 2030 CWG; Ahmedabad the host city
content: The Indian Olympic Association has officially endorsed India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games, with Ahmedabad proposed as the host city. This decision follows Canada's withdrawal, improving India's chances, and a recent venue inspection by Commonwealth Sport officials. India are aiming for an inclusive Games, featuring traditional sports alongside core events, after the 2026 edition reduced its sports roster.

title: 'Will destroy Jagannath temple': Terror graffiti found on wall near Puri shrine
content: Panic has ensued in Puri following the discovery of threatening messages scrawled on a wall near the Jagannath temple, warning of a potential terror attack. The graffiti, found near the Heritage Corridor, referenced Prime Minister Modi and included phone numbers, raising serious security concerns.

title: Uber salary: From entry-level roles to top mgt- breakdown based on H-1B data
content: Uber is transforming into a super app, expanding beyond ride-hailing. This requires skilled corporate employees. Uber is hiring more international talent through H-1B visas. Data reveals salary ranges for engineers, data scientists, and managers. Staff Software Engineers earn $225,200 to $266,400 per year. Senior Managers earn $230,800 to $299,700. Total compensation includes equity and bonuses.

title: 'Champs' to 'Legacy': Kiyan Anthony remixes Carmelo's iconic Syracuse image in ink
content: carmelo Anthony's son, Kiyan, tattooed an image of his dad after he won the national title . in the original image, Carmelo held up a newspaper with a giant headline of "Champs" in place of his father . "it's surreal to see, honestly," a post shared by sportsCenter NEXT .

title: 'He's the heartbeat of the team': Why Terry McLaurin, Commanders can't get a deal done
content: wide receiver Terry McLaurin bounded out of the team's facility two weeks ago . he signed a three-year deal in 2022 . his mood mirrored what the commanders have insisted about him .

title: Oneil Cruz hurt; Orioles shut down multiple pitchers
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . oneil Cruz left Tuesday's game after bumping heads with Jack Suwinski . he was replaced by a pinch hitter in the sixth inning .

title: Panthers, Flyers top NHL teams acknowledging Swift's new album
content: the "Get Up" crew shares their excitement about Taylor Swift's new album . the news came as Swift teased her appearance on the "New Heights" podcast . Swift and Kelce attended the 2025 Stanley Cup final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers .

title: ✈️ Air Force reveals new F-16 fighter uniforms
content: the air force Falcons unveil its 2025 " Air Power Legacy Series" threads . the helmet is similar to that of a fighter jet . it is also displayed as a tribute to col. William Andrews, who used the word as call sign .

title: Turn it up to 11: Brewers hammer Skenes, Pirates
content: the Brewers crush five home runs in a 14-0 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates . the ace right-hander is one of the most dominant pitchers in baseball this season . his 11-game winning streak is their second of the season and the second longest in franchise history . they are the first national league team to accomplish the feat .

title: Ranking the top 50 players in baseball right now: MLB Rank 2025 in-season update
content: a week into the 2025 MLB season, we created our annual MLB Rank list . we asked 17 experts to give their ranking of the top 50 players in the sport this season . based on their overall impact on the season, the list features the MVPs and Cy Young Award winners you'd expect .

title: Has Sanchez passed Skenes for NL Cy Young? Judge or Raleigh for AL MVP? Latest on all of MLB's award races
content: this month's awards watch reflects changes atop some races and separation in others . the two methods of tracking these things are in complete accord when it comes to anointing the current favorites . a lot can and will change in short period of time in a big league baseball season .

title: 2025 Fantasy Football Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .
